  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** This module provides some facilities for creating references (and hash
  17.     tables) which can easily be snapshoted and restored to an arbitrary version.

  19.     It is used throughout the frontend (read: typechecker), to register all
  20.     (well, hopefully) the global state. Thus making it easy for tools like
  21.     Merlin to go back and forth typechecking different files. *)

  23. (** {1 Creators} *)

  25. ‌val s_ref : 'a -> 'a ref
  26. (** Similar to {!val:Stdlib.ref}, except the allocated reference is registered
  27.     into the store. *)

  29. ‌val s_table : ('a -> 'b) -> 'a -> 'b ref
  30. (** Used to register hash tables. Those also need to be placed into refs to be
  31.     easily swapped out, but one can't just "snapshot" the initial value to
  32.     create fresh instances, so instead an initializer is required.

  34.     Use it like this:
  35.     {[
  36.       let my_table = s_table Hashtbl.create 42
  37.     ]}
  38. *)

  40. (** {1 State management}

  42.     Note: all the following functions are currently unused inside the compiler
  43.     codebase. Merlin is their only user at the moment. *)

  45. ‌type store

  47. ‌val fresh : unit -> store
  48. (** Returns a fresh instance of the store.

  50.     The first time this function is called, it snapshots the value of all the
  51.     registered references, later calls to [fresh] will return instances
  52.     initialized to those values. *)

  54. ‌val with_store : store -> (unit -> 'a) -> 'a
  55. (** [with_store s f] resets all the registered references to the value they have
  56.     in [s] for the run of [f].
  57.     If [f] updates any of the registered refs, [s] is updated to remember those
  58.     changes. *)

  60. ‌val reset : unit -> unit
  61. (** Resets all the references to the initial snapshot (i.e. to the same values
  62.     that new instances start with). *)

  64. ‌val is_bound : unit -> bool
  65. (** Returns [true] when a store is active (i.e. when called from the callback
  66.     passed to {!with_store}), [false] otherwise. *)
